titles.title: A bill to amend section 17 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 to permit a State agency to use 25 percent of the savings achieved through the purchase of supplemental foods at reduced prices for the costs of nutrition services and administration associated with increases in the number of persons served.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.
Referred to Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary and Vocational Education.

bill.summary: 10/7/1987--Introduced. Amends the Child Nutrition Act to permit a specified amount of savings from supplemental food program purchases to be used for the additional nutrition services and administrative costs of feeding an increased number of persons.
